diary.description:
YAHOO.widget.Diary produces a weekly diary showing events, and allows them to
be editted.
diary.title:
Diary widget
Diary uses a YAHOO.util.Datasource with, minimally, start and end dates.
Items in the diary can be rescheduled using drag and drop, or times changed using resize.
New items can be added by click-and-dragging on the diary to provide the 
start and end times.
diary.requires: yahoo, event, event-delegate, event-mouseenter, dom, datasource, selector, dragdrop, resize, datemath, calendar
diary.name: diary

YAHOO.widget.Diary.name: YAHOO.widget.Diary

startDate.description: When to start the diary display from

endDate.description: Final date currently displayed on Diary

allowCreateMultiDayItems.description: Whether, when creating new items, they're allowed to span multi days

calenderNav.description: Whether to use a YAHOO.widget.Calendar in the navigation.

itemClickCreateNew.description:
Whether you can click and drag on an existing item 
to start creating a new one.

fieldMap.default:
{ DTSTART: "DTSTART",
           DTEND:   "DTEND",
           SUMMARY: "SUMMARY",
           DESCRIPTION: "DESCRIPTION",
           URL: "URL",
           backClass: "backClass",
           detailClass: "detailClass" }
fieldMap.description:
Field map, mapping keys of DataSource to expected 
keys of data for DiaryItems.  DiaryItem keys are the keys in the 
object passed; values are the names of the fields in the DataSource.
backClass is the css class string applied to the background container of the
DiaryItem; detailClass is the css class string applied to the element
holding the text of the item.  These can be used by addItemFilter
to show or hide items by category.

width.type: Number (Optional) Will use element styled width if no value provided and it has one

tooltip.description: Whether to use tooltip for mouseover events to show details

titleString.description:
String to use as template for title.  You can use 
strftime type identifiers.

animate.description: Whether to use animation when moving items around

display.description:
Display formats: object literal with format and start and end times (in 24-hour clock hours) displayed in the main window (the rest are above and below the scroll. 
{ format: "week", startTime: 8, endTime: 20 }
. The only format available currently is "week".

scaleColumns.description: Whether to scale columns to width

params.name: el
params.description: Container element for the Diary

params.name: oDS
params.description: DataSource instance.

params.name: oCfg
params.description: Object literal of config values.

constructors.description:
The main diary; 
This is the main object:
- gets the data
- does the main background display
- sets up the DiaryDay objects and calls their render methods
- holds delegated event listeners

_getDay.description: Returns a Date object with times set to 0

return.description: Date or first if it doesn't fall in range.

_findFirstItemDay.description:
Looks for the first day between startDate and endDate that has a column
in the diary; multi-day items may not start in range but may go into it.

params.name: Array
params.description: Selected date, as returned by YAHOO.util.Calendar (ie array [[[ yyyy, mm, dd]]])

_doCalNav.description: Go to any start date (set by calendar)

params.description: object

params.name: Data
params.description: returned by DataSource

_endSelector.description: Called at the end of selector - creating a new item by drag-drop

params.name: Request
params.description: object that failed

_dataFailed.description: Called if sendRequest fails on the data

_applyFilters.description:
Re-applies all filters currently in place.
Called internally when navigating to keep existing filters in place

_applyFiltersToElement.description:
Re-applies all filters to the element passed.
Called internally when navigating to keep existing filters in place.

_renderTooltip.description: Renders tooltip for showing full info

return.description: boolean        True if oItem2 is before oItem1

_itemSorter.description: Sorting function for arranging items in ascending date/time order
_itemSorter.param: Object    Property DTSTART used for sorting

params.name: Number
params.description: of items hidden

addItemFilter.description:
Filters DiaryItems based on css selector.
selector passed will be appended directly to ".lplt-diary-item"
If nothing is passed, it will filter for all (ie hide everything)

_doFirstDayOfTodaysWeek.description: Goes to the start of this week

initListeners.description: Set up delegated event listeners for rendering and mouse events

_renderDays.description: Loops through starting at startdate to render days

_destroyDays.description: Destroys the days rendered in the diary

params.name: Object
params.description: Data for the new item, minimally:

params.description: Whether to redraw once it's added

_startNewItem.description: Click and drag to add new DiaryItem

initData.description: Store a reference to the data and get it

_sameDay.description: Are date1 and date2 the same day?

getItem.description: Returns the DiaryItem with id elId

removeItemFilter.description:
Removes filter on DiaryItems based on css selector.
selector passed will be appended directly to ".lplt-diary-item"
If nothing is passed, it will filter for all (ie show everything)

_renderNav.description:
Renders the navigation. 
Provides left, today, calendar and right buttons, and adds listeners.

_reDo.description: Redraws calendar, deleting DiaryItems and data currently held first

_getData.description: Gets data from the data source

getNavContainer.description: Returns the container for the navigation els

_resizeSelectorDiv.description: Resizes the selector when creating a new item

_getEndOfDay.description: Returns a Date object with times set to 23:59:59

setupDays.description: Display days of the week holders

_tooltip.description: Re-usable tooltip, if included on page

_colToDayMap.description: provieds a map from columns id's to dates (in seconds)

_selector.description: Holds details of a click-and-drag to add new Items

_ds.description: Reference to the datasource passed in

YAHOO.widget.Diary.description:
The main diary; 
This is the main object:
- gets the data
- does the main background display
- sets up the DiaryDay objects and calls their render methods
- holds delegated event listeners

_displayDTSTART.descripiton: Start time as displayed - may be different to DTSTART for multi-day items

useAnimation.description: Whether to use animation after drag drops

multiDayPosition.description: Where this item falls if it's a multi-day event

getParentItem.description:
Provides access to the parent item.  For single-day events, it's this,
for multi-day events it's the parent, which will give proper dates/times etc
and ids for editing and so on.

getStartTimeDay.description: Gets the start time ( milliseconds) of the day of this item (ie at 00:00)

getStartTimeSecs.description: Gets the start time as seconds from 00:00

setLine.description: Which 'line' (ie what offset) is this one in?

setEndTimeSecs.description: Sets the end time (but not date) from seconds

renderFullDetails.description: Returns a string showing full details of the item.

setStartTimeSecs.description: Sets the start time (but not date) from seconds

dragdrop.description:
The YAHOO.util.DD instance.
We don't use the built-in one with Resize because some events don't
come through properly.

TIME_SEPARATOR.description: String that separates hours and minutes

DiaryItem.description:
DiaryItem class for individual items in the Diary.
Data and display for particular diary item.
Extends resize (and includes drag drop).  This class shouldn't be used
directly; items to be added should be added by the Diary.addItem() method.

DiaryBlock.name: DiaryBlock

addItem.description: Adds a DiaryItem to the block.

params.name: Object
params.description: Literal containing width property of entire column

render.description: Renders the DiaryItems in the block

_findLineForItem.description: Will the item fit in an existing vertical line?

contains.description: Does item overlap with this block?

return.description: True if removed, false if not found

params.name: DiaryItem
params.description: to remove

removeItem.description: Removes an item from the block

_endSecs.description: Time, in seconds, of the end of this block.

_startSecs.description: Time of day, in seconds of the start of this block.

_items.description: Array of DiaryItem in this block.

DiaryBlock.description:
A block of diary items.
Holds diary items that overlap in time within a single day.  You won't want
to deal with these directly.

_dataEl.description: HTMLElement holding the HTMLElements for the DiaryItems

previous.description: Gets the previous column, or null if it's the first

removeItemFromBlock.description: Removes an item from its block

DiaryDay.param: {HTMLElement || String} Html element to render to

width.description: Width of the column (as an integer) in pixels.

diary.description: reference to the Diary object holding this DiayDay

DiaryDay.description: A days worth of diary items. Contains none or more DiaryBlocks.
